Hello, 

I was just thinking about NERO. I suddenly made the connection bet=
ween 
the sensor placements and the substrates for the robot experiment in =

D'Ambrosio's paper. It is so similar. So I begin to think.. What about 
NE=
RO, but using HyperNEAT? The substrates can be made geometrically 
similar =
to the.. enivonment, you know what I mean. 
I will try to implement a 2D ve=
rsion of something similar to NERO, but 
with leaky integrator neurons, bec=
ause there every node has a bias and 
I don't have to care about where to p=
lace the bias unit in the 
substrate. 
Besides, I have the following idea. =
During evolution, in the first 
generations (in the rtNEAT case, the first =
N minutes of evolution), the 
substrates will be simple, with low node coun=
ts. Then, given a 
threshold (num. of generations/time), the program will a=
utomatically 
scale up the substrate to a higher density. 

Any suggestions=
/ideas about that? 

Peter
